title: Why your face could be set to replace your bank card
description: Already widely used in China, facial recognition payment is now expanding in other countries.

title: FA Cup: Tammy Abraham hits a superb hat-trick for Chelsea against Luton Town
description: Watch Tammy Abraham's superb hat-trick against Luton Town as the England striker sends the Blues into the FA Cup fifth round.

title: Snow in the UK: Wintry weather in pictures
description: Heavy snow brings a flurry of opportunities to take wintry photographs.

title: Pets and kids enjoy snow day
description: People sent in their footage of snowy landscapes to the BBC, and shared content on social media.

title: UK firms told 'set up in EU to avoid trade disruption'
description: Firms say they have been advised by officials to set up EU hubs, but the government says it is not policy.

title: China mine rescue: Eleven miners brought to surface alive
description: Efforts to free the miners, who were stuck underground for 14 days, took a dramatic turn on Sunday.

title: Snow: Severe weather warnings in place across UK
description: The weather has led to the temporary closure of four coronavirus vaccination centres in Wales.

title: Learning disability vaccine plea: 'Don't leave us to rot'
description: As high risk groups continue to be immunised there are growing concerns that people with learning disabilities have been missed out.

title: Covid: Hackney railway arch rave attended by '300 people'
description: Organisers padlocked the door from the inside to stop officers getting in, police said.

title: Sturgeon: I did not mislead Scottish Parliament over Salmond
description: The first minister denies claims she knew about harassment allegations earlier than she told parliament.

title: JoJo Siwa: YouTube star 'never been this happy' after coming out
description: The teenage YouTube star is supported by fans and celebrities as she talks about her sexuality.

title: South Africa coronavirus variant: 77 cases found in UK
description: Matt Hancock says cases are under "very close" observation and enhanced contact tracing is under way.

title: Covid: Birmingham student party guests 'travelled 200 miles'
description: Some guests were found hiding in cupboards when police raided student flats in Birmingham.

title: McGregor v Poirier 2: Irishman shocked in UFC rematch at Fight Island
description: Conor McGregor is left stunned on his return to the UFC as Dustin Poirier wins their rematch at UFC 257 by technical knockout.

title: Smart motorways 'dangerous' - police chief
description: The claim comes after a coroner ruled two deaths on the M1 motorway were avoidable.

title: Covid: New Zealand reports first case in the community in months
description: The woman, who recently returned from Europe, had completed two weeks in isolation.

title: The Papers: Vaccinated told to follow rules and PM's jab 'gamble'
description: Many of Sunday's papers focus on what the Covid jab means for lockdown, case numbers and schools.

title: Janice Nix: The drugs kingpin who joined the Probation Service
description: Janice Nix used to be one of London's most notorious drug dealers. How did she turn her life around?

title: In pictures: Tens of thousands gather for pro-Navalny protests
description: Tens of thousands braved a police crackdown to show support for jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny.

title: The great graphics card shortage of 2020 (and 2021)
description: Gamers have been facing inflated prices for months - and it's set to stretch into 2021.

title: Tunisians question whether life is better after Arab Spring
description: Ten years after ousting their strongman leader, some say the new system isn't working.

title: The homeless drug addict who became a professor
description: Jesse Thistle, a high school dropout, overcame addiction and homelessness to pursue an academic career.

title: The paper that helped the homeless
description: How Street News became the first newspaper sold by homeless and unemployed vendors

title: Is this Russian cult leader a fraud?
description: A mysterious Russian cult leader is accused of embezzling followers' funds and abusing them.

title: 'I couldn't breathe': The 26-year-old with Covid
description: Twenty-six-year-old Mae Mamaril and her family all tested positive for Covid-19 at the end of 2020. Mae was the only one who was moved to an intensive care unit.

title: Coronavirus: 'Lockdown made me feel like I was in prison'
description: John Nicholl, who is deafblind, says his use of hands-on sign language left him isolated in lockdown.
